item.title: The Power of Hoping in God’s Meticulous Providence
item.itunes:author: John Piper
item.dc:creator: John Piper
item.description: John Piper | Because God’s purposeful sovereignty reaches absolutely everywhere, his gospel can satisfy, his mission will succeed, and his people can never be lost.

item.title: Why You Do Not Believe
item.itunes:author: Marshall Segal
item.dc:creator: Marshall Segal
item.description: Marshall Segal | Jesus’s sheep are happy to be his, and Jesus will never leave them behind. But why would anyone reject this patient, kind, and powerful Savior?
item.itunes:keywords: sermon, message, John Piper, Desiring God, Bible, 163859

item.title: The Supremacy of Christ Our Hope
item.itunes:author: John Piper
item.dc:creator: John Piper
item.description: John Piper | There has never been, nor will there ever be, a greater reality than the God we see when we look at Jesus Christ. His very supremacy is our deepest hope.
item.itunes:keywords: sermon, message, John Piper, Desiring God, Bible, 163859

item.title: Boasting Only in the Cross
item.itunes:author: John Piper
item.dc:creator: John Piper
item.description: John Piper | When you die, only what you do for Christ will last. You have one life. Don’t waste it on insignificant comforts.

item.title: Finishing with Joy

item.description: John Piper | Faith, which is the root of all true obedience that glorifies God, is a coming to God to be satisfied with all that he is for us in Jesus, which means that the pursuit of joy in the Christian life is not optional, but essential.
